immediateReliefPage.gentleMovementDescription: Gentle stretching and yoga poses can help relieve menstrual cramps by improving circulation, releasing muscle tension, and promoting relaxation.

poses.name: Child's Pose (Balasana)
poses.description: Kneel and fold forward, arms extended
poses.benefits: Relieves back pain, calms the mind

poses.name: Cat-Cow Pose (Marjaryasana-Bitilasana)
poses.description: Alternate between arching and rounding your spine
poses.benefits: Increases spinal flexibility, massages abdominal organs

poses.name: Supine Twist
poses.description: Lie on back, bring knees to chest, drop to one side
poses.benefits: Releases lower back tension, aids digestion

exercises.name: Deep Belly Breathing
exercises.steps: Breathe deeply into your belly, expanding it fully

exercises.name: 4-7-8 Breathing
exercises.steps: Inhale for 4, hold for 7, exhale for 8 seconds
exercises.benefits: Calms nervous system, reduces pain perception

timing.title: When to Practice:
timing.preventive: Preventive: Practice daily during the week before your period
timing.during: During pain: Gentle movements only, listen to your body
timing.continuous: Continuous: Regular practice improves long-term outcomes

immediateReliefPage.breathingExerciseDescription: Controlled breathing activates your body's relaxation response, reducing stress hormones and pain perception. It's free, portable, and can be done anywhere.
